Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis; interior glazed black with three added red bands; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of siren or sphinx (face and chest remaining) to right; head and neck of boar to left; incised blob rosette as filling ornament; possibly some added red on figures.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.800.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 331, no. B381)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0766) (Phase 1)
